comments.body: Are we sure the name can't contain spaces?  What about the id?  If the name could but the id can't, then can we assume that everything in between the "device" and the id is the name?
I've seen two different devices output names in a similar pattern, so I'm assuming (because I haven't asked or checked source code) that they follow a fairly standard naming pattern.
I've seen two different devices follow this pattern, which I'm assuming is a fairly standard name generation schema. I haven't followed up with anyone about it, so just an assumption at this point.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +228,232 @@    // Note: the provided command works around a bug in -N, see US-515
    // for more explanation.
    final List<String> command = <String>[
      'ssh', '-6', '-F', fuchsiaSdk.sshConfig.absolute.path, '-nNT', '-vvv', '-f',
      '-L', '$hostPort:$_ipv4Loopback:$devicePort', device.id, 'true'

comments.body: This may not actually cause the process started in forward() above to end. It may need to be manually killed. See: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/fuchsia_reload.dart#L486. This is important to avoid colliding with subsequent attempts to set up a tunnel.
Followed the example in fuchsia_attach - I close the ServerSocket and kill the original process

This actually wont work, since the first time we'll always get a message like 'stderr: Warning: Permanently added 'fe80::250:b6ff:fe1e:f80d%eth1' (ED25519) to the list of known hosts.'. I could use a regex to filter that out but i don't feel great about that
